required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimization of the Core Number and Location for Targeted Prostate Biopsy
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study of Optimizing the Core Number and Location for MRI/Ultrasound Fusion Targeted Prostate Biopsy

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the effect of core number and location optimization for targeted prostate biopsy on pathological accuracy.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center prospective study. The investigators perform MRI/US image fusion targeted saturation biopsy on prostate lesions with PI-RADS score 4, to investigate the effect of core number and location optimization for targeted prostate biopsy on pathological accuracy.

primary_outcome.measure: The significant prostate cancer detection rate with different combinations of core number and location in the targeted saturated biopsy area
primary_outcome.time_frame: When histology results available, at an expected average of 3 days post-biopsy

intervention.description: MRI/Ultrasound fusion saturation biopsy: the core number and location are designed according to the lession condition.

facility.name: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School
responsible_party.investigator_title: Executive officer of Department of Urology, Drum Tower Hospital, Medical School of Nanjing University, Institute of Urology, Nanjing University
